H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3282.def: = a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4886.def: = causative action by which humans apply a liquid like oil or paint to an object by pouring or rubbing ► for the purpose of cleaning, preserving, beautifying, eating, or for consecrating for religious service

H1319.def: = action by which humans pass on information to someone else, having been commissioned to do so by a deity or another person

H6035.def: = state of persons who are suffering and unable to help themselves ◄ because of their own need or status, or the result of someone else's behavior ≈ often used positively of persons who are sincere and not arrogant in their behavior

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H2280.def: = state in which something has been wrapped around part of someone's body

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H1865.def: = process by which a liquid flows slowly, forming large drops

H7617.def: = a person or group that has been forcibly carried off into slavery or exile

H631.def: = causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control

32.gl: to break (someone's) heart > to cause profound grief

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7522.def: = state in which deities or humans in a position of authority are favorable disposed towards a person or activity

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5359.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H57.def: = pertaining to being in a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H57.def: = pertaining to being in a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H6287.def: = head-dress; ◄ made out of cloth; ► worn by priests, but also by ordinary men and women, probably on special occasions; not to be worn when in mourning; ≈ therefore associated with joy

H665.def: = powdery residue left after the burning of a substance; normally deposited outside of a village or city; ► used by mourners to put on their heads or roll themselves into; ≈ associated with things that are fine and powdery and easily scattered by the wind, with low status, and possibly with mortality as well

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H8342.def: poetic term; = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H60.def: = a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions

H4594.def: exact meaning unknown; probably: = large piece of cloth, word around the body

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3544.def: literally: a weakened spirit; hence: = state in which humans have lost courage

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H352.def: = male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat-tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H4302.def: = action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6286.def: = action by which humans check the branches of a tree after having beaten it; ► in order to find any remaining fruit

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H2723.def: = state in which a land, building, or town has been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore

H7223.def: = state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H2318.def: = causative action by which humans restore an object to make it function again in the way it has functioned before

H2721.def: = state in which an object is free from moisture or liquid

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H5236.def: = state in which something is associated with a nation or country that is different from one's own

H406.def: = person practicing agriculture as his profession

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H3548.def: = person {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to perform religious services on behalf of others

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H3235.def: = action by which humans utter words about themselves, usually with the purpose of drawing all attention to themselves

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H1322.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H4932.def: = state in which something has twice its normal size, quantity, frequency, or intensity

H3639.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H2506.def: = one part of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided into several portions

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H8057.def: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H1498.def: = action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H6468.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H6631.def: = object which derives from or comes from another object, used for plants and, by extension, for humans

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H5234.def: = process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H7797.def: poetic term; = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H1523.def: mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H3468.def: = a state in which a human or deity helps a human in need to be safe / a safe state

H3271.def: = causative action by which deities cover humans with clothing

H4598.def: = long garment, hanging down to the ankles, ◄ usually made of wool, ► and worn over the {L:tunic<SDBH:כֻּתֹּנֶת>}; it is not clear whether it had sleeves or not, nor whether it was open or closed in the front; ≈ certain attitudes and emotions are often described in terms of such a garment, e.g. "he wore fury like a robe"

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H2860.def: = man who is about to be married or has just been married; ≈ often associated with joy

H3547.def: = state in which humans have been {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to function as a {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}

H6287.def: = head-dress; ◄ made out of cloth; ► worn by priests, but also by ordinary men and women, probably on special occasions; not to be worn when in mourning; ≈ therefore associated with joy

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

20.gl: to clothe (someone with a certain state)

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H6780.def: = process by which new growth comes up, either springing from the ground or from part of an existing plant, and starts growing; ≈ sometimes extended to denote the coming into existence of people, conditions, or activities

H1593.def: = a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as a burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance

H2221.def: = a plant's units for reproduction, ► intended for being sown and produce

H6779.def: = process by which plants, trees, or hairs come up and start growing; ≈ sometimes extended to denote the coming in existence of people, conditions, or activities

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do
